high_relevance.description: Learning occurs through increasing participation in communities of practice, moving from peripheral to full participation
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Directly addresses the novice-to-core developer transition pathway in OSS communities
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Model AI's impact on legitimate participation pathways - does AI create new peripheral activities or bypass traditional ones?
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Theorizing how AI transforms legitimate participation pathways in OSS communities of practice

high_relevance.description: Organization's ability to recognize, assimilate, and apply new external knowledge
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Explains how developers and projects absorb AI-generated code and knowledge
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Model project/developer capacity to evaluate, integrate, and build upon AI contributions
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Extending absorptive capacity theory to AI-human collaboration in OSS
model_additions: Prior knowledge stocks for AI evaluation

high_relevance.description: Individuals are motivated by developing competence and receiving positive feedback
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Explains how AI affects developer motivation and skill development pathways
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Model how AI-assisted contributions affect perceived competence and motivation feedback loops
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Understanding AI's impact on competence development and motivation in OSS careers

adjacent_opportunities.description: Artifacts that enable coordination between different social worlds while maintaining their individual meanings
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Focuses on artifacts rather than people, but highly relevant to collaboration
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: AI-generated code as boundary objects between human developers and AI systems
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Theorizing AI outputs as boundary objects in OSS development

adjacent_opportunities.description: Cognitive processes are distributed across individuals, artifacts, and environments
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Shifts focus from individual learning to system-level cognition
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Modeling OSS communities as distributed cognitive systems now including AI agents
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Understanding how AI redistributes cognitive labor in OSS development

adjacent_opportunities.description: The purposive action of individuals and organizations aimed at creating, maintaining, and disrupting institutions
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Focuses on institutional level rather than individual career paths
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: How core developers engage in institutional work to adapt OSS norms and practices to AI era
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Understanding institutional maintenance work in OSS facing technological disruption

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Community structure changes over time as species replace one another
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Model OSS community succession patterns as AI changes skill requirements and role definitions
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Provides dynamic framework for understanding long-term community transformation

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Human and non-human actors form networks that shape social outcomes
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Treat AI systems as actors in OSS development networks with agency and influence
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Radically reframes AI as active participant rather than passive tool

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Innovations that render existing skills obsolete vs those that build on them
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Characterize AI programming tools as competence-destroying or enhancing for developer careers
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Provides strategic framework for understanding AI's disruptive potential

phd_strategy.rationale: These theories directly address the core research question while providing complementary perspectives: learning pathways, knowledge integration, and motivation dynamics
phd_strategy.integration_strategy: Use LPP as primary framework for career pathways, augmented by absorptive capacity for knowledge integration and competence motivation for individual development drivers
phd_strategy.expected_impact: Creates comprehensive theoretical framework explaining how AI transforms OSS career paths through learning, knowledge, and motivation mechanisms
